body:
Comment 8: 
Hi Rob, your argument about possible totally-unrelated programs with the same name
in $GOPATH/bin is a good one.

I just wanted to mention that the current situation is less than ideal in another
scenario:
what if a binary distribution user (who install Go to /usr/local/go) issues the following
command as a short hand for installing gotype and oracle:
go install code.google.com/p/go.tools/cmd/...

he will get permission denied error because go will try to write godoc, vet and cover
to $GOROOT.

I agree that vet, cover and godoc are special, so perhaps we should arrange them in
a separate directory in go.tools sub-repository to avoid confusions like this.
